skill.name: email

Email operations skill for sending, fetching, and reading emails via IMAP/SMTP.
Uses curl with OpenSSL/LibreSSL for reliable TLS compatibility with Tencent Enterprise Mail and other providers.
Credentials are securely stored in macOS Keychain.

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate email operations skill. All static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The combination of shell scripts, network connections (IMAP/SMTP), and credential access (Keychain) is EXPECTED and INTENTIONAL for email functionality. Passwords are securely stored in macOS Keychain, never in config files. No malicious patterns, data exfiltration, or suspicious external connections detected.

content.user_title: Send and manage emails via IMAP and SMTP
content.value_statement: This skill enables sending, fetching, and reading emails directly from your terminal using IMAP and SMTP protocols. It securely stores credentials in macOS Keychain and supports multiple email providers including Tencent Enterprise Mail and Gmail.
actual_capabilities: Send emails via SMTP with TLS encryption and attachment support
Fetch email headers from IMAP servers with MIME decoding
Read full email content including headers and body
Multi-account support with secure macOS Keychain credential storage
limitations: Requires macOS with Keychain for credential management
No attachment handling or HTML email composition yet
Server-side IMAP search may be unreliable on some providers

best_practices: Always confirm recipient addresses before sending important emails
Store passwords in macOS Keychain instead of config files
Use app-specific passwords when available for enhanced security
anti_patterns: Do not store email passwords in plain text files
Do not skip TLS verification for email connections
Do not send emails without confirming the content first

faq.question: Which email providers are supported?
faq.answer: Any provider with IMAP/SMTP access including Gmail, Outlook, Tencent Enterprise Mail, and custom email servers.

faq.question: How are passwords stored?
faq.answer: Passwords are stored securely in macOS Keychain using the security command, never in configuration files.

faq.question: Is OAuth2 supported?
faq.answer: OAuth2 authentication is not yet implemented. Currently only password-based authentication is supported.

faq.question: Can I send attachments?
faq.answer: Attachment handling is planned for future enhancement. Currently only inline text and file-based body content are supported.

faq.question: Does this work on Linux?
faq.answer: This skill is designed for macOS due to Keychain integration. Linux users would need to modify credential handling.

faq.question: What ports are used?
faq.answer: Standard ports 993 for IMAP and 465 or 587 for SMTP. All connections use TLS encryption.
